CARDINAL . ORG ( IDEA ) has identified CARDINAL broad types or models of electoral management – the independent , governmental and mixed models ( see ORG : ORG ) . The independent model of electoral management exists in those countries where elections are organised and managed by an electoral management body which is institutionally independent and autonomous from the executive branch of government , and which has , and manages , its own budget . It may be accountable to the legislature , the judiciary , or ORG , but not to the government . The governmental model exists in those countries where elections are organised and managed by the executive branch through a ministry ( such as ORG ) and/or through local authorities . In the mixed model of electoral management , there are usually CARDINAL component bodies , and dual structures exist : a policy , monitoring or supervisory body that is independent of the executive branch of government and an implementation body located within a ORG and/or local government .
